alert.note: Alert for Coke; Runnels; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coke, east central Sterling, north central Tom Green and western Runnels Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 919 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, or near Robert Lee, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Maverick, Bronte, Orient, Norton, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Water Valley, Broome, Tennyson, Wilmeth, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059 and Us- 87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
